home.slogan: An online tool for applying the {0} approach to findings of a qualitative evidence synthesis

auth.login_error: The user or password are wrong or doesn't exist. try again.
auth.subscribe_text: Would you like to subscribe to the GRADE-CERQual mailing list?

account.email_exists_error: There is already an account for this email address or the email is wrong formatted
account.email_username_hint: Your email address is your username for logging-in to iSoQ.
account.password_placeholder: Write a strong password with at least 8 alpha-numeric characters
account.repeat_password_placeholder: Write the same password as above
account.individual_info: As an individual, you will be able to create iSoQ tables, but they will remain in your personal space (i.e. they will be only visible when logged in your account).
account.share_info: In order to share iSoQ tables with others you need to join an existing organisation or create a new one.
account.nonprofit_confirm: confirm this is a non-profit organisation
account.can_create_share: Now, you can create and share iSoQ tables with your organisation.
account.thanks_registering: Many thanks for registering your organisation
account.start_using_now: You can start using iSoQ right now and move your work to the organisation when created.
account.email_sent: An email was sent to you with instructions for resetting your password.
account.password_min_chars: Enter a password with at least 8 characters
account.password_changed: Password has been changed. Please login with your new password.

validation.title_min_length: The project must have a title that contain at least 3 characters
validation.at_least_one_author: The project must have at least one author
validation.corresponding_author_min_length: The project must have a corresponding author with at least 3 characters
validation.valid_email: The project must have a valid author email address
validation.question_min_length: The project must have a review question with at least 3 characters
validation.valid_url_doi: The project must have a valid URL or DOI
validation.list_authors_required: The project must have a list of authors
validation.publish_requirement: The project must have at least one review finding with a complete GRADE-CERQual assessment to be published to the iSoQ database. Select “Private” until you are finished.
validation.license_required: The project must have a license

project.completed_by_authors: Is the iSoQ being completed by the review authors?
project.name: Project name
project.optimize_info: To optimise the functionality of iSoQ, and save you time, please add the following information organised into 4 steps.
project.create_new_isoq: Create a new Interactive Summary of Qualitative Findings Table
project.temp_link_warning: You have a temporary link enabled for this project. It will remain enabled until you manually switch it off. Click here to switch it off
project.inclusion_exclusion: Study inclusion and exclusion criteria used in the review
project.list_authors_isoq: Please list the authors of this iSoQ
project.revert_private_warning: By removing this content your project will revert to "private" as it will no longer meet the requirements for being published to the iSoQ database. Do you wish to continue?
project.insert_title_desc: Insert the title that you plan to use for this report or paper.
project.authors_desc: First then last name of all authors separated by commas
project.insert_question_placeholder: Insert main question that the review addresses
project.publish_desc_private: When you finish your iSoQ you can publish some, or all of it, to the iSoQ database. Until you are finished, keep it “private”. You can change these settings at any time.
project.publish_desc_public: When you finish your iSoQ you can publish some, or all of it, to the iSoQ database. These options become available once you have entered the required project properties and have at least one review finding with a complete GRADE-CERQual assessment.
project.additional_info_placeholder: Add any additional information important to your review, for example, if it was part of a guidelines process or commissioned by an organization or government
project.status_private_text: Private - Your iSoQ is not publicly available on the iSoQ database
project.status_fully_text: Fully Public - Your iSoQ table, Evidence Profile, and GRADE-CERQual Worksheets are publicly available on the iSoQ database
project.status_partially_text: Partially Public - Your iSoQ table and Evidence Profile are publicly available on the iSoQ database
project.status_minimally_text: Minimally Public - Your iSoQ table is available on the iSoQ database
project.license_cc_by_nc_nd_exp: This license allows reusers to copy and distribute the material in any medium or format in unadapted form only, for noncommercial purposes only, and only so long as attribution is given to the creator.
project.license_cc_by_nd_exp: This license allows reusers to copy and distribute the material in any medium or format in unadapted form only, and only so long as attribution is given to the creator. The license allows for commercial use.
project.license_cc_by_nc_sa_exp: This license allows reusers to distribute, remix, adapt, and build upon the material in any medium or format for noncommercial purposes only, and only so long as attribution is given to the creator. If you remix, adapt, or build upon the material, you must license the modified material under identical terms.

project.license_cc_by_sa_exp: This license allows reusers to distribute, remix, adapt, and build upon the material in any medium or format, so long as attribution is given to the creator. The license allows for commercial use. If you remix, adapt, or build upon the material, you must license the modified material under identical terms.
project.license_cc_by_exp: This license allows reusers to distribute, remix, adapt, and build upon the material in any medium or format, so long as attribution is given to the creator. The license allows for commercial use.

references.step_title: STEP 1: Upload the references for your included studies (required)
references.must_import: You must import only the references for your final list of included studies
references.restore_upload: We found a previous upload that didn't complete. Would you like to restore it?
references.export_step: STEP 1: Export the references for your included studies from your reference management software (e.g. Endnote). You must select RIS as the output style.
references.import_step: STEP 2: Import the .ris/.txt file into iSoQ.
references.reminder: Reminder: If you later add studies to your review, you can do a second import of these and they will be added to your existing list.
references.pubmed_instructions: You can import individual references from PubMed by pasting the references PMID below. The PMID is the 8-digit identification number appearing at the end of the web address for the article on PubMed. Add one PMID per line below and click Find.
references.ref_not_found: The reference could not be reached, try again or using other ID
references.invalid_pmids: The following PubMed IDs are invalid
references.references_loaded: You have {count} references loaded listed below
references.delete_all_warning:
This action will delete all the references and all the data linked to them, including Characteristics of Studies Table, Methodological Limitations Table, Extracted Data tables, and all the GRADE-CERQual assessments in the Evidence Profile and Summary of Qualitative Findings Table.
Are you sure you want to delete all the references?
references.exclude_study_warning: You are about to exclude a study from your review. This will delete it, and all associated information, from all tables in iSoQ. If you exclude this study please remember to redo your GRADE-CERQual assessments for all review findings that it supported.
references.confirm_delete: Are you sure you want to delete this reference?
references.select_first: To select references, first upload your full reference list by clicking "Import References" next to the search bar.
references.no_findings_affected: No review findings will be affected.

inclusion.step_title: STEP 2: Enter the study inclusion and exclusion criteria used in the review (recommended)
inclusion.inclusion_placeholder: Please enter the study inclusion criteria used in the review
inclusion.exclusion_placeholder: Please enter the study exclusion criteria used in the review

characteristics.step_title: STEP 3: Create or import your characteristics of studies table (recommended)
characteristics.description: Descriptive information extracted from the included studies (e.g. setting, country, perspectives, methods, etc.)
characteristics.column_help: Column headings describe the categories of the descriptive information extracted – e.g. setting, country, perspectives, methods, etc.
characteristics.no_author_year: Do not add columns for author or year (these will be added automatically)
characteristics.no_meth_here: Do not add methodological assessments (critical/quality appraisal). These go in a separate table.
characteristics.confirm_delete_row: Are you sure you want to delete all the content for this row?

import_modal.beware_text: The iSoQ import feature does not import data that is formatted in any way. For example, if your table has cells formatted with bold text, superscript, subscript, indentation, bullet points etc. these will not be displayed.
import_modal.overwrite_warning: The newly imported and saved data will delete and replace any previous data entered manually or through import.
import_modal.steps_title: To upload a table, follow these steps:
import_modal.step1: STEP 1: Download the template (excel file), save it to your computer, and populate it with your information.
import_modal.save_as_csv: When you save the file, choose 'CSV-UTF-8 (Comma delimited) (*.csv)' as the "Save as type"
import_modal.template_problems: If you have problems with the template this may be due to the version of Excel you are using or your settings. We recommend you work on the table in Google Sheets (Gdrive)
import_modal.columns_warning: The first two columns «Reference ID» and «Author(s), Year» must not be altered in any way.
import_modal.step2: STEP 2: Import the populated template to iSoQ
import_modal.step3: STEP 3: Look at the preview of the table below and accept or reject it
import_modal.accept_info: If it looks right, accept the import by clicking the "Save" button at the bottom of the page.
import_modal.reject_info: If something doesn't look right, remove it by clicking the "Reject" button at the bottom of the page and return to Step 2.
import_modal.format_error: Your data might be wrongly formatted and therefore will not display. Check that you saved your file as the following file type: CSV-UTF-8 (Comma delimited) (*.csv). Also check that your table has at least one column.

meth_assessments.description: Methodological assessments of each included study using an existing critical/quality appraisal tool (e.g. CASP)
meth_assessments.enter_assessment: Enter both your assessment and the explanation for your assessment here

worksheet.meth_assessments_intro: To add data or make changes to this table do so in the {link} section of iSoQ
worksheet.no_evidence_profile: No evidence profile has been created

methodological_limitations.no_concerns: No or very minor concerns regarding methodological limitations that are unlikely to reduce confidence in the review finding
methodological_limitations.minor_concerns: Minor concerns regarding methodological limitations that may reduce confidence in the review finding
methodological_limitations.moderate_concerns: Moderate concerns regarding methodological limitations that will probably reduce confidence in the review finding
methodological_limitations.serious_concerns: Serious concerns regarding methodological limitations that are very likely to reduce confidence in the review finding

coherence.no_concerns: No or very minor concerns regarding coherence that are unlikely to reduce confidence in the review finding
coherence.minor_concerns: Minor concerns regarding coherence that may reduce confidence in the review finding
coherence.moderate_concerns: Moderate concerns regarding coherence that will probably reduce confidence in the review finding
coherence.serious_concerns: Serious concerns regarding coherence that are very likely to reduce confidence in the review finding

adequacy.no_concerns: No or very minor concerns regarding adequacy that are unlikely to reduce confidence in the review finding
adequacy.minor_concerns: Minor concerns regarding adequacy that may reduce confidence in the review finding
adequacy.moderate_concerns: Moderate concerns regarding adequacy that will probably reduce confidence in the review finding
adequacy.serious_concerns: Serious concerns regarding adequacy that are very likely to reduce confidence in the review finding

relevance.no_concerns: No or very minor concerns regarding relevance that are unlikely to reduce confidence in the review finding
relevance.minor_concerns: Minor concerns regarding relevance that may reduce confidence in the review finding
relevance.moderate_concerns: Moderate concerns regarding relevance that will probably reduce confidence in the review finding
relevance.serious_concerns: Serious concerns regarding relevance that are very likely to reduce confidence in the review finding

cerqual.high: It is highly likely that the review finding is a reasonable representation of the phenomenon of interest
cerqual.moderate: It is likely that the review finding is a reasonable representation of the phenomenon of interest
cerqual.low: It is possible that the review finding is a reasonable representation of the phenomenon of interest
cerqual.very_low: It is not clear whether the review finding is a reasonable representation of the phenomenon of interest
cerqual.progress_bar: This progress bar shows you how far along you are in making your GRADE-CERQual assessment of confidence. You have 5 assessments to make in total. Firstly, an assessment for each of the 4 GRADE-CERQual components, and lastly the overall assessment.

definitions.methodological_limitations: The extent to which there are concerns about the design or conduct of the primary studies that contributed evidence to an individual review finding
definitions.coherence: An assessment of how clear and cogent the fit is between the data from the primary studies and a review finding that synthesises that data. By ‘cogent’, we mean well supported or compelling
definitions.adequacy: An overall determination of the degree of richness and quantity of data supporting a review finding
definitions.relevance: The extent to which the body of evidence from the primary studies supporting a review finding is applicable to the context (perspective or population, phenomenon of interest, setting) specified in the review question
definitions.cerqual: Assessment of the extent to which a review finding is a reasonable representation of the phenomenon of interest
definitions.references: Studies that contribute to this review finding
definitions.chars_tooltip: Descriptive information extracted from the contributing studies (e.g. country, participants, topic, setting, etc.)
definitions.meth_tooltip: Table with your methodological assessments of each contributing study using an existing quality/critical appraisal tool (e.g. CASP)

tooltips.data_missing: Data are missing. Click link to see what's missing.
tooltips.provide_explanation: Provide an explanation for your assessment

worksheet.assessment_added_isoq: Your GRADE-CERQual assessment has been added to the iSoQ for this finding. Click “return to iSoQ table” above to view it

questions.methodological_limitations: Do you have any concerns about the methodological quality of contributing studies as a whole that could lower your confidence in the review finding?
questions.coherence: Do you have any concerns about the coherence between the review finding and the underlying data that could lower your confidence in the review finding?
questions.adequacy: Do you have any concerns about the adequacy of the data (richness and /or quantity) supporting the review finding that could lower your confidence in the review finding?
questions.relevance: Do you have any concerns about the relevance of the underlying studies to your review question that could lower your confidence in the review finding?
questions.adequacy_bold: Do you have any concerns about the adequacy of the data (richness and /or quantity) supporting the review finding that could lower your confidence in the review finding?

reminders.whole_body: Remember this is an assessment of the whole body of evidence supporting this review finding, not an assessment of an individual contributing study.
reminders.coherence: Remember, coherence is not about the consistency of findings between studies, but is about the fit between the extracted data and the review finding as you have written it.
reminders.coherence_concerns: You may have concerns if some of the data from included studies contradict the review finding, if it's not clear if some of the underlying data support the review finding, or if there are plausible alternative descriptions, interpretations or explanations that could be used to synthesise the data.
reminders.relevance_concerns: You may have concerns if some of the underlying data are of indirect relevance, of partial relevance, or if it is unclear whether the underlying data is relevant.

warnings.data_missing_link: Data are missing. Click link to see what's missing.
warnings.data_missing_assessment: Data needed to make this assessment are missing. Click button below to see what's missing.
warnings.chars_missing: The Characteristics of Studies table, or some data within it, are missing.
warnings.meth_missing: The Methodological Assessments table, or some data within it, are missing.
warnings.extracted_data_missing: The Extracted Data table, or some data within it, are missing.
warnings.incomplete_explanation: It looks like you have not finished writing an explanation for your judgement
warnings.changed_option: By changing this assessment, you will need to redo your overall GRADE-CERQual assessment of confidence. Your confidence level selection will be cleared, and your explanation erased. Your notes will be maintained.
warnings.revert_private: Your project will revert to "private" and be removed from the iSoQ database. You can publish the project to the database once you have completed your GRADE-CERQual assessment of confidence.
warnings.clear_cerqual_revert: By clearing this assessment, this iSoQ project will revert to "private" and no longer appear on the iSoQ database. You can republish it when you have at least one review finding with a complete GRADE-CERQual assessment and associated references.
warnings.clear_cerqual_simple: By clearing this assessment, this review finding will no longer appear in your published iSoQ project.
warnings.review_question_missing: The review question is missing. Add it in
warnings.inclusion_missing: The inclusion criteria are missing. Add them in
warnings.exclusion_missing: The exclusion criteria are missing. Add them in
warnings.extracted_data_missing_detail: Some or all of the extracted data for this review finding are missing. Add them into the table below using the edit button for each included study.
warnings.chars_of_studies_missing: The Characteristics of Studies table, or some data within it, are missing. Add missing table/data in

labels.explanation_required: The GRADE-CERQual approach requires you to include an explanation for your judgement.
labels.example_intro: If concerns about coherence and relevance contribute most to my decision to downgrade to “low confidence” then I will briefly summarise these specific concerns in brackets e.g.
labels.example_body_1: No/very minor concerns regarding methodological limitations, Moderate concerns regarding coherence
labels.example_body_bold_1: (some contradictory opinions expressed in the underlying data but not reflected in finding)
labels.example_body_2: , No/Very minor concerns regarding adequacy, and Serious concerns regarding relevance
labels.example_body_bold_2: (indirectly relevant because studies are all from high income rather than LMICs)
labels.example_footer: [non bolded text is the minimum required text generated automatically and the bolded text are the details I have added]
labels.select_level: Select a level of concern above and complete the sentence that appears below to explain your concerns (not required for no/very minor concerns)
labels.cerqual_question: To what extent is the review finding a reasonable representation of the phenomenon of interest?
labels.cerqual_explanation_instruction: Below is the minimum text required for an explanation. Now add detail about the specific concerns for the component(s) that most contributed to your assessment.
labels.notes_description: Optional space for reviewers to leave notes for each other while working on GRADE-CERQual assessments
labels.explanation_required_with_link: The GRADE-CERQual approach requires you to include an explanation for your judgement. Click {link} to see an example
labels.cerqual_guidance_link: for practical guidance on making an overall assessment of confidence for a review finding.

worksheet.extracted_data_intro: It is here that you enter the data extracted from included studies that support this review finding. This data is needed to make a GRADE-CERQual assessment.
worksheet.add_extracted_data_label: Add the extracted data from this study that supports the review finding

table.no_methodological: No methodological assessments has been created,

about.title: About
about.what_is_isoq_p1: The GRADE-CERQual Interactive Summary of Qualitative Findings (iSoQ) is an online tool designed to:
about.what_is_isoq_li1: Assist review authors with applying the GRADE-CERQual approach to the findings of a qualitative evidence synthesis (systematic review of qualitative studies) and presenting these in a summary of qualitative findings table.
about.what_is_isoq_li2: Assist review authors with managing and archiving data for GRADE-CERQual assessments.
about.what_is_isoq_li3: Make GRADE-CERQual assessments more accessible to end users, including decision makers and those who support them.
about.launch_text: In March 2022 we launched the software with a webinar {0} and {1} of the software.
about.gc_desc: {0} is an approach for transparently assessing and describing how much confidence decision makers and other users can place in individual review findings from syntheses (or systematic reviews) of qualitative evidence. An overall GRADE-CERQual assessment of confidence is based on an assessment of four components: methodological limitations, coherence, adequacy and relevance.
about.when_use: When in the review process can I use the iSoQ tool?
about.when_use_p1: You can begin using this tool once you have finished the study screening process and have a list of included studies that meet the inclusion criteria for your synthesis (systematic review). In the early stages of a systematic review, the iSoQ tool can be used to help organise some of the data that are needed to apply GRADE-CERQual, for example, tables of the characteristics of included studies and of the methodological limitations of the included studies (critical appraisal tables).
about.when_use_p2: The primary function of the tool is to assist review authors with managing the process of applying the GRADE-CERQual approach to their review findings. GRADE-CERQual is applied near the end of a review process, at the point when reviewers have completed analysis and synthesis and have draft summaries of each review finding.
about.when_use_p3: For more information on where GRADE-CERQual fits into the review process please see the {0}
about.epoc_template: EPOC QES protocol and review template.
about.replace_software: Does the iSoQ tool replace other kinds of software used in reviews?
about.replace_desc: No, this tool is specific to applying the GRADE-CERQual approach. It is not a replacement for other commonly used software in systematic reviews like reference management software (e.g. Endnote), software for screening and selecting studies (e.g. Covidence and Distiller SR), or software and programs for extracting and analysing data (e.g. DistillerSR, NVivo, Microsoft Excel).
about.invite_collaborators: Can you invite collaborators to an iSoQ project?
about.invite_desc: Yes. You can invite collaborators (for example other review authors) to a shared project and assign them either "view only" or "view and edit" rights. These collaborators need to set-up an iSoQ account in order to access the shared project. You can also generate a temporary link to send to collaborators who only need to view the project for a limited amount of time (for example a guideline panel or a peer reviewer).
about.export: Can I export from the iSoQ tool into other programs?
about.export_desc: Currently you cannot directly export the content within the iSoQ tool into other platforms, but you can export and download a Microsoft Word or PDF copy of the Summary of Qualitative Findings Table and Evidence Profile Tables. These can be copy and pasted or imported into other programs such as RevMan, GRADEpro GDT, or MAGICapp. Characteristics of Studies, Methodological Assessments and Extracted Data tables created in the iSoQ tool can be downloaded into a Microsoft Excel compatible format.
about.public: Can iSoQ tables be made public for anyone to see?
about.public_desc: iSoQ includes a "publish" function, meaning you can publish some or all of your completed Interactive Summary of Qualitative Findings Table to the iSoQ database. It is up to you to decide if and when to publish to the iSoQ database and to ensure you are not infringing any copyright issues (for example you may have to abide by an embargo period or wait for a manuscript to be published). The database will become a repository for iSoQ tables.
about.mac_desc: iSoQ can be used on a Mac but has not been extensively tested with Mac. We are aware of one common issue for Mac users and that is with the "import table" function in the My Data section. When our Excel template is downloaded and opened in Excel for Mac, columns A and B are merged instead of separate. This causes import failure and serious malfunctioning in the software. We therefore recommend Mac users work on the template in either Google docs, Open Office or LibreOffice. Be sure to save the file as a "comma-separated values" (CSV). We welcome feedback from Mac users so we can continue to improve your experience with iSoQ.
about.funding: How is the iSoQ tool funded?
about.funding_desc: The development of the iSoQ tool is supported by funding from the Norwegian Institute of Public Health's Centre for Epidemic Interventions Research (CEIR). Additional funding for members of the development team is provided by the Western Norway University of Applied Sciences (HVL), the Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU) and the Epistemonikos Foundation.
about.licence: How is the iSoQ tool and its contents licenced?
about.licence_li1: The code underlying the iSoQ software, produced and run by the Epistemonikos Foundation, is licensed under a {0}
about.licence_li2: The methods content developed specifically for iSoQ (e.g. pop-up and modal texts, tooltips, prompts, examples, help videos) is licensed under a {0}
about.licence_li3: Methods content drawn directly from already published {0} are licensed under a {1}
about.licence_li3_link: GRADE-CERQual papers in the journal Implementation Science
about.licence_li4: Users who publish some or all of their Interactive Summary of Qualitative Findings projects to the iSoQ database will be prompted to choose a {0} licence for their work. The default will be {1}.
about.cite_desc: Cite as: GRADE-CERQual Interactive Summary of Qualitative Findings (iSoQ) [Computer program]. Version 1.0 accessed [insert date]. Oslo, Norway: Norwegian Institute of Public Health (developed by the Epistemonikos Foundation, Megan Wainwright Consulting and the Norwegian Institute of Public Health for the GRADE-CERQual Project Group). Available at isoq.epistemonikos.org

browse.title: Browse public iSoQ tables
browse.desc: Review authors using the iSoQ tool can choose to publish some or all of their interactive Summary of Qualitative Findings table to the database below. The GRADE-CERQual project group does not currate this database, therefore we cannot attest to whether or not the GRADE-CERQual approach was applied appropriately and in line with our {0}.

soqf_table.auto_numbering: Automatic numbering of summarised review findings
soqf_table.finding_summary: Summaries of each review finding produced by the review team
soqf_table.confidence_desc: Assessment of the extent to which a review finding is a reasonable representation of the phenomenon of interest
soqf_table.explanation_desc: Statement explaining concerns with any of the GRADE-CERQual components that justifies the level of confidence chosen
soqf_table.studies_contribute: Studies that contribute to each review finding
soqf_table.no_findings: There are no findings to show,
soqf_table.user_editing: The user {first_name} {last_name} is editing this finding. The edit mode is disabled.
soqf_table.tips_writing: Click here for tips for writing a summarised review finding
soqf_table.group_optional: You can leave this option blank. You can always assign a finding to a group later.
soqf_table.notes_placeholder: Optional space for reviewers to leave notes for each other about this review finding
soqf_table.delete_warning_revert: Warning! Deleting this finding will also delete its associated GRADE-CERQual Assessment Worksheet and revert your project to "Private" because it will no longer meet the requirements for being published to the iSoQ database.
soqf_table.delete_warning: Warning! Deleting this finding will also delete its associated GRADE-CERQual Assessment Worksheet.
soqf_table.confirm_remove: Confirm you want to remove {name} from the iSoQ table?
soqf_table.remove_ref_warning: Warning! By removing a reference you are modifying the underlining evidence base for this finding and will need to review your GRADE-CERQual assessments. If you remove the reference, the extracted data you inputted from this study to support this finding will be deleted from the GRADE-CERQual Assessment Worksheet.
soqf_table.remove_all_unpublish: By removing all references this review finding will no longer appear in your published iSoQ project. Do you wish to continue?
soqf_table.remove_all_revert: By removing all references for this review finding this iSoQ project will revert to "private" as it will no longer meet the requirements for being published to the iSoQ database. Do you wish to continue?

methodological_limitations.0: No/very minor concerns regarding methodological limitations because
methodological_limitations.1: Minor concerns regarding methodological limitations because
methodological_limitations.2: Moderate concerns regarding methodological limitations because
methodological_limitations.3: Serious concerns regarding methodological limitations because

coherence.0: No/very minor concerns regarding coherence because

adequacy.0: No/very minor concerns regarding adequacy because

relevance.0: No/very minor concerns regarding relevance because

publish.publish_tooltip: Click here when you have finished your iSoQ to select what you would like published to the publicly available iSoQ database
publish.print_tooltip: Click to enter view mode where you can export or print
publish.publish_info: By publishing your iSoQ to the online database, your contribution becomes searchable, readable and downloadable by the public. Please select a visibility setting below and click "publish". Click the icon next to each to see an example. We recommend users choose Fully Public to maximise transparency. You can change your visibility settings at any time in Project Properties.
publish.license_info: Please choose a Creative Commons licence under which you would like to publish your work to the iSoQ database. The default is CC-BY-NC-ND.
publish.read_more_cc: Read more about Creative Commons licenses here
publish.license_responsibility: It is your responsibility to ensure that publishing your work to the iSoQ database does not violate any existing licencing agreement – e.g. with academic journals or funders.
publish.must_select_license: You must select a Creative Commons license.

video_help.title: Help video
video_help.missing_data: Some or all of the extracted data for this finding are missing.

action_table.import_warning: Import data will destroy the loaded previous data.
action_table.confirm_drop: This action will remove all the data. Are you sure?
action_table.search_placeholder: Type to search the text in the table below

worksheet_nav.select_studies: Select Studies Contributing to Review Finding

updates.assessment_no_delete_title: Changing your assessment won't delete your explanation
updates.assessment_no_delete_desc: Based on user feedback, iSoQ will no longer delete the text you have written in an explanation box if you change your choice of level of concern or level of confidence.
updates.view_only_worksheets_title: Users with "view only" rights now see Worksheets
updates.view_only_worksheets_desc: When a user is invited to a project but assigned "view only" rights they can now see (but not edit) all pages including project properties, My Data section, iSoQ table and Worksheets with the Evidence Profile.
updates.accessibility_title: Accessibility: Increase and decrease text size
updates.accessibility_desc: You will now find a +A and -A in the top right corner of the screen so that you can adjust the size of the font throughout iSoQ.
updates.check_refs_title: Prompt to check your references, success starts here!
updates.check_refs_desc: When you import your references in Step 1 of the MyData section of iSoQ, your imported studies are now displayed, thus prompting you to look them over before manually moving to Step 2. It is important to make sure that your references have imported correctly and are complete. You cannot currently edit your references within iSoQ.
updates.margins_title: Narrower margins = easier viewing of content
updates.margins_desc: The margins have been reduced throughout the platform to maximize what you are able to see in tables and modals.
updates.help_training_title: New section in help tab – iSoQ training
updates.help_training_desc: We have added links to iSoQ training webinars on the Help page
updates.newsletter_title: Facilitating access to information on iSoQ development
updates.newsletter_desc: Users are now prompted to sign-up to the GRADE-CERQual newsletter when they create an account or change their password. GRADE-CERQual newsletters are sent three times a year and include the latest news about the iSoQ platform, upcoming training or webinars, and other resources for applying the GRADE-CERQual approach
updates.mydata_redesign_title: We have redesigned the My Data page for easier navigation
updates.mydata_redesign_li1: A table of contents on the left makes visualising and moving between each step easy
updates.mydata_redesign_li2: Edit and delete buttons for each row in the tables (step 3&4) remain visible even when scrolling
updates.mydata_redesign_li3: Scroll over the Authors names to see the title of the paper in Steps 3&4
updates.no_jumping_li1: Previously iSoQ defaulted to jumping to the top of the page when the user navigated between pages. Now iSoQ holds your spot on the page thus reducing scroll time.
updates.no_jumping_li2: You will notice this enhancement especially when navigating back and forth between the iSoQ table and the GRADE-CERQual Assessment Worksheets for each finding.
updates.leave_project_li1: Users can now leave a project that was shared with them by clicking the "leave" button in My Workspace
updates.leave_project_li2: This will remove the project entirely from My Workspace

steps.step_4_description: STEP 4: Create or import your methodological assessments table (recommended)
steps.step_4_long_description: Methodological assessments of each included study using an existing critical/quality appraisal tool (e.g. CASP)

modals.drag_drop_instruction: Drag and drop findings to re-order them in the iSoQ table
modals.categories_long_description: Some reviewers choose to organise their review findings into different groups, for example into themes or topics. To do so, add the names of the groups here. After you have created groups for your review findings you will be prompted to assign each new review finding to a group. You can choose not to assign a review finding to a group, or assign it later.
modals.categories_numbering_instruction: Use numbers (1,2,3) or letters (a,b,c) before the name of the group to set the display order for the exported/printed Summary of Qualitative Findings and Evidence Profile tables. For example, 1. Feasibility, 2. Acceptability.
modals.confirm_delete_group: Are you sure you want to remove the review finding group
modals.add_data_title: Add data needed to make GRADE-CERQual assessments

table_headers.title: Title
table_headers.extracted_data: Extracted data supporting the review finding

actionButtons.publish_tooltip: Click here when you have finished your iSoQ to select what you would like published to the publicly available iSoQ database
actionButtons.view_mode_tooltip: Click to enter view mode where you can export or print

modal.title: Publish to the iSoQ Database
modal.publish_info: By publishing your iSoQ to the online database, your contribution becomes searchable, readable and downloadable by the public. Please select a visibility setting below and click "publish". Click the icon next to each to see an example. We recommend users choose Fully Public to maximise transparency. You can change your visibility settings at any time in Project Properties.
modal.license_info: Please choose a Creative Commons licence under which you would like to publish your work to the iSoQ database. The default is CC-BY-NC-ND.
modal.license_info_link_text: Read more about Creative Commons licenses here
modal.license_responsibility: It is your responsibility to ensure that publishing your work to the iSoQ database does not violate any existing licencing agreement – e.g. with academic journals or funders.
modal.must_select_license: You must select a Creative Commons license.

status.private: Private - Your iSoQ is not publicly available on the iSoQ database
status.fully: Fully Public - Your iSoQ table, Evidence Profile, and GRADE-CERQual Worksheets are publicly available on the iSoQ database
status.partially: Partially Public - Your iSoQ table and Evidence Profile are publicly available on the iSoQ database
status.minimally: Minimally Public - Your iSoQ table is available on the iSoQ database
